top.title: Trump administration will tap emergency fund to pay partial food stamp benefits
top.summary: The shutdown has deprived more than 40 million Americans of food assistance, known as Snap, since Saturday.

top.title: China academic intimidation claim referred to counter-terrorism police
top.summary: Sensitive research  into alleged human rights abuses is alleged to have been shut down by Chinese agents.

top.title: Agony for families as landslide death toll climbs in Uganda and Kenya
top.summary: More than 40 people are known to have died since last week, according to officials.

top.title: Online porn showing choking to be made illegal, government says
top.summary: Possession and publication of such material will be a criminal offence, under amendments to the Crime and Policing Bill.

top.title: Shein bans all sex dolls after outrage over childlike products
top.summary: Every listing and image related to the sex dolls has been removed from Shein's platform, the firm said.

top.title: Government disappointed by unexpected O2 price rise
top.summary: The technology secretary says O2's higher-than-expected price increase is "disappointing" given the cost of living.
